Fields.DialogueText: Savoia?
What are you doing up on deck at this hour?
I could ask you the same question.

Fields.MenuText: Ha ha, fair enough.
You could. But I'm the captain here.
So, you're in that kind of mood.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Capitano. I thought it was quite good myself.
Ah, you're always so serious, Capitano.
I suppose I am!
Just one of the benefits of a life on the sea. No lights, no cities... just black water and the endless sky.
You know, the stars are beautiful here, but they really don't compare to...
... to nights in the Caribbean, where "the Milky Way hangs low and wide over the warm waters and crickets chirp just at earshot."
Oh dear! Am I so predictable?
Not such a bad thing. You really do talk about the Caribbean a lot, though.
Hmm, maybe it's not a bad thing.
You didn't answer my question.
Hm? What question?
Why were you out on deck, Capitano?
Taking a tour of the ship. I get a more candid look at the ship when the crew doesn't know I'm coming.
Ah.
Yep. Say, do you see that constellation?
*ALARM*
Damn. Get to your stations!
@BATTLE
Savoia?
Hm?
Is my Belle okay?
Sì. Sì. Why wouldn't I be?
You kind of, uh, blanked out for a moment. We're in the middle of drills, remember?
Oh. Right! Hoist the mainsail! Run up the flag! Uh, raise the, um, antennae?

Fields.MenuText: What are you talking about?
You heard her! Hoist the mainsail!
Very funny.

Fields.DialogueText: Just a little joke, Capitano.
Oh, I didn't think you'd actually go along with it.
Thank you, I try.
All jokes aside, are you sure you're okay?
Yes, Capitano. I've just been a little... distracted lately.
Well, if you want to talk about it, you know where to find me.
Of course.
We've got Morganas on the radar!
Well, looks like the rest of those mainsail drills will have to wait!
@BATTLE
What are you looking at with that telescope, Capitano? Are there Morganas approaching?
Take a look for yourself, Savoia.
Whales! They are such majestic creatures, aren't they? Of course, we saw the most beautiful whales in the Caribbean, but-
If you finish that sentence, I'm going to throw you in the brig.
It sounds like someone doesn't want me to make Caribbean cook-up again.

Fields.MenuText: Okay, fine, you can tell your dumb story about the Caribbean.
Hey, now! I thought the Morganas were bad.
Hold up, can't we negotiate here?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry. I'll only make it as dumb as I need to so that you can understand it.
You should see what they're like when people interrupt their stories.
Sorry, no negotiation during wartime.
As I was saying, the-
*ALARM*
Saved by the bell.
@BATTLE
Capitano! We have a sighting!
Get me a classification on that contact. Morganas?
No, Capitano. It's... a merchantman, moving at top speed.
Wait a moment... There. Look! Behind them!
Morganas. Lt. Silvio, set course to intercept.
Yes, Capitano!

Fields.MenuText: We need to aid civilians when we can.

Fields.DialogueText: I was just about to say the same thing myself.
Don't forget who's captain here, Savoia.
We're all well aware of that.
Thank goodness we have your bold leadership.
All hands to stations!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Got enough speed to catch them, Savoia?
Protecting merchants... How exciting.

Fields.DialogueText: I have it under control, Capitano.
One of our mandates, Capitano.
It looks like that Morgana group's been dealt with, for now.
The merchant ship is sending a boat over, Capitano.
Oh? Let them aboard.
Oh, oh, Capitaine! You came in just the nick of time.
I'm glad you're all safe.
The merchant marine is the lifeblood of our effort against the Morganas.
Of course. Now, I have a little gift for you, Capitaine, and your lovely Belle companion, in exchange for your timely rescue.
I don't know if I can say she's my comp--
A bottle of wine?
Quite a rare vintage, I assure you.
We're grateful for your gift, Monsieur Hulot. Thank you.
No, thank you.
Fair winds, Monsieur.
Well, what do you think we should do with our new gift?

Fields.MenuText: I'll admit, I'm not really a big fan of wine.

Fields.DialogueText: No, you seem like more of a liquor person to me, Capitano Tough-Navy-Officer.
*ALARM*
Looks like there's another wave.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Special occasion wine for you and me.
Save it? Maybe we can drink it when the war's over.

Fields.DialogueText: I can't say, Capitano, just as long as no one drinks it on-duty.
What occasion would that be, exactly? Got something special in mind for us?
@BATTLE
Savoia? Savoia!
I'm right here, Capitano.
Are you all right?
I'll be fine.

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure? That was a pretty tough battle.

Fields.DialogueText: I am a warship, Capitano. I was made for tough battles.
You spend every battle on deck. Would you consider instead staying on the bridge, where it's safer?
I'm sorry, but I couldn't. I understand why you're on the bridge. It's your post, and you need to be there to relay orders and survey the situation.
But I can't ask my crew to do anything I wouldn't do myself, and that includes standing out on deck during a battle.
That makes sense. Still, consider my offer. I won't order you, but you are a... valuable asset. It makes strategic sense to keep you safe.
Sì, Capitano. I will consider it.
Here they come. Battle stations!
That was a near miss, I'm afraid.

Fields.MenuText: I'm glad to hear that.
Ah, I knew you would be. I just wanted to be sure.

Fields.DialogueText: Me, too.
Then why did you sound so concerned, hm?
We are picking up contacts on the radar, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Push the maintenance through faster, Lieutenant. That Morgana group may be beaten for now, but they'll be back. Again... and again...
Um, yes. Yes, Capitano.
What's wrong?
Nothing, Savoia. Just tired of these Morganas.
I know what you mean. Every time we beat one, she always come back, as if our victory didn't matter.

Fields.MenuText: I hope you're not losing faith.
We'll win this, no matter how long it takes.
With our crew and your leadership? We'll come out on top eventually.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course not, Capitano. Are you?
But it's taking a long time.
Thank you, Capitano, but I really can't take credit.
You performed quite well in that battle. I know I don't say this often, but you are a skilled capitano. It's an honor serving with you.
... Thanks, Savoia.
Is that smell what I think it is?
Depends. What do you think it is?
I think it's Caribbean cook-up.
Then you would be correct.
What's the occasion?
The crew have been really hitting their marks lately on the drills. I figured they could use a reward.

Fields.MenuText: Wait, you're making Caribbean cook-up for everyone on the ship?
Wow, that's a lot of cooking.
Do you have time to make all that?

Fields.DialogueText: Sì. Do you think that will be a problem?
I dare say you're right!
No, but that's okay. I'll make time.
How about I help you? I've eaten it enough. I feel like I half-know the recipe already.
Hmm, that would actually help speed things up a bit. Why don't you start chopping these vegetables?
*ALARM*
Right after this.
@BATTLE
Well, that's a busted cannon...
Savoia!
Capitano?
Are you all right?
I am, but this gun needs repair.
Have the mechanics take a look at it. We'll schedule repairs as soon as possible.
Don't worry about it too much. It's one of the smaller guns, so it can wait.

Fields.MenuText: Nonsense! We have to keep the ship in top fighting shape.
No damage can wait.
Very well, but I'll still have the mechanics take a look.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course. I only meant that the job is a minor one.
Sometimes it must.
Of course - but don't focus too many resources on it.
All hands to battle stations!
@BATTLE
Here you go, Capitano.
Hmm? Thanks!
I was just in the mess and I picked you up a cup of tea.

Fields.MenuText: Oh! Thank you, Savoia.
Um, I'm more of a coffee drinker, but thanks for the thought.
We have tea?

Fields.DialogueText: It was nothing.
Don't you think it's a little late in the day to be drinking coffee?
That merchant sent a crate over with the wine.
So when's the wedding?
Ha ha!
Excuse me?
Oh. Um, I have a pipe, to uh, fix. Captain.
You and Eugenio di Savoia. There's obviously some chemistry between you.
What? No! She's my subordinate. Or something.
Kind of a gray area... but, uh, maybe it's none of my business, Capitano.
No. It isn't. Good day, Lieutenant.
Capitano.
Damnit.
Keeping busy?
Oh, Capitano! Trying to, yes.
What are you reading there?
Pride and Prejudice.

Fields.MenuText: That's kind of appropriate, in a way.
"Every happy family is the same, but every unhappy family is uniquely unhappy."
Both of them?

Fields.DialogueText: Why? Are you in need of a wife?
I believe that's Anna Karenina, Capitano, and I don't think you quite got the quote right.
Very droll, Capitano.
Look, um, we need to talk.
Oh?
Some crew members have been speculating on the, um, nature of our relationship.
And honestly, I think it is something that we are going to need to address.
What is there to say? Any such relationship would be highly inappropriate. We should probably do what we can to stop the gossip.
Is that it? I feel like there's more to say.
*ALARM*
Are you kidding me? Now?!
@BATTLE
"Dear diary..."
"My feelings for the Capitano are becoming confusing. One thing I know: I can never speak of this recent development. It would just make things too complicated."
Savoia, I just wanted to talk to you about the other day.
OH! Capitano!
Wait, is that a diary?
You're surprised? Many people have them.

Fields.MenuText: Well, yes.
I guess not. I'd just never thought about you having a diary.
You always seemed more interested in reading books than writing in them.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't see why you should be.
Well, now you can.
Well, this book has blank pages, so it's a bit different.
Many important historical personages have kept diaries. In fact, diaries have given us valuable insight into many elements of the past.
Anyway, about before...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capitano, I was going over our supplies manifest. I have a question for you.
Ah, Savoia! Just the Belle I was looking for.
Is that so?
Yes. About our talk...
What talk was that?

Fields.MenuText: You can't possibly have forgotten already.
It's not healthy to keep this bottled up.
Would talking really be that bad?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe I just don't want to waste my time. Or yours.
Thank you, Dr. Freud.
It's not the conversation that will be hard.
Look, as your captain, I am ordering you to sit and talk about how to address these rumors.
*ALARM*
Oh, no, a battle! I have to go now.
@BATTLE
Look off the port beam, Capitano. Prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
Okay. There shouldn't be any battles for a while, now. Savoia! We should talk.
We're talking right now.
What else is there to say?

Fields.MenuText: What do you mean? There's everything to say.
Let's start with how you feel.
How about a direct answer?

Fields.DialogueText: Is there?
Do you have a couch for me to lie on, too?
I... I'm not sure either of us would like that.
We need to get this out in the open, Savoia.
There is nothing to discuss, Capitano. Military discipline calls for professionalism in this aspect. A relationship between us would muddy the chain of command and set a poor example for the crew.
That's what you want to tell the crew if the rumors persist?
Honestly? I prefer not to give it any credence at all.
Capitano! I just got a letter.
Oh?
The navy is holding a gala to celebrate the worldwide voyages of Italians in the past, and I was chosen to host it!
That's great, Savoia!
I suppose. While it is a great honor, I have a feeling it will also get in the way of our mission.

Fields.MenuText: But Savoia, just think how much brass is going to be there!
You're right, but we have to do what we have to do.
Maybe, but it will be nice to take a break.

Fields.DialogueText: That's what I'm afraid of.
Unfortunately, sometimes.
But will the Morganas let us take a break?
*ALARM*
Okay, I admit that's not a great sign.
@BATTLE
Okay, okay, easy with that table. It's expensive.
Who is that?
She's the decorator. She just arrived. Someone from HQ sent her over to prepare for the gala.
What is she doing?
Right now? Moving tables.

Fields.MenuText: Tables? Won't those get in the way?
No. No, there is no way I'm going to let someone set up tables in the middle of my deck.
I think it's a bit early to start decorating.

Fields.DialogueText: As long as we don't get attacked. So, yes.
Then I suggest you talk to her. I tried, but she said she would only listen to you.
I agree, but apparently this is going to be quite the event.
Excuse me! Miss!
Oh, hello. You must be the captain.
Yes, and I'm afraid I'll have to ask you-
*ALARM*
Oh, dear. That doesn't happen often, does it?
@BATTLE
I'm still not sure about this.
You're confused about holding the gala?
I find I'm confused about a great many things these days.
What was that?
Nothing, Capitano. You're right, though. I am confused about holding this gala. While I am honored, it feels like a waste of time to me.

Fields.MenuText: Sometimes we have to follow orders even when they don't make sense.
The brass like a party.
It will give people something to think about other than the war.

Fields.DialogueText: But throwing a party? What's the strategic value of that?
I hope that's not the only reason for the gala.
Good point. At least the crew will enjoy it.
*ALARM*
Watch out for the tables!
@BATTLE
Capitano!
Yes, Savoia?
Tell this woman I don't have to wear her dress for the gala.
It's not my dress, dear.
I don't care whose dress it is. I'm not wearing it. It's impractical.

Fields.MenuText: Wait, but don't you already dress pretty nicely?
What's wrong with wearing a nice dress?
But will you still be able to wear your armor?

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly! Why should I need some fancy dress?
It's not exactly military, is it?
No! I won't be!
The dress has been sent by Navy high command for the gala. It's supposed to be a nice thing.
Maybe we can figure something out. What if-
Morganas on the radar!
I hope we lose this battle and we all sink.
@BATTLE
Now, which color do you prefer, Miss Savoia?
Um, what's the difference?
Well, this is beige, and this is ecru.
They don't look significantly different to me.
How's the decorating coming?
Which color do you like better?
Um, what's the difference?
*SIGH* This one is beige, and this is ecru.

Fields.MenuText: I think I've been to Ecru.
I like beige better.
I like ecru better.

Fields.DialogueText: That was one of the countries I visited on my voyages, too!
Okay! Wait, which one is it?
You'll have to remind me which one that is.
Is this really necessary?
I was told to get your input on decorating, since this gala is going to, in part, honor you.
*ALARM*
Thank God, something important to do.
@BATTLE
Well, the gala starts tonight, Savoia. Are you excited?
I probably should be, but really I'm nervous.
Really? You've never struck me as the type to be nervous around powerful people.
That's not it. It's true, I'm not really a fan of parties, but it's more than that.
Oh, so you're nervous about something going wrong? I think that's reasonable.
Sì, and also of... other things.

Fields.MenuText: What other things?
Do you want to talk about it?
Is this about what I think it is?

Fields.DialogueText: I think you probably know.
I... no, I don't think so.
Probably, Capitano. It's... not easy for me, either.
Sometimes you're such a mystery to me.
*ALARM*
Huh, let's hope this doesn't take too long.
@BATTLE
Keep the guns firing! We'll put this group of Morganas down in short order, crew!
@BATTLE
There we go. Morganas defeated, and we didn't even lose any decorations.
Actually, all the bunting off the starboard side is gone.
Eh, it's a night event anyway.
And all the lights fell overboard.
Well, we still have running lights.
That's what I always picture when I think of swank. Capitano...
Yes?
I want you to know this isn't easy for me.

Fields.MenuText: I understand.
No, I get it.
That is a little comforting to hear, actually.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope so.
Are you sure?
I'm glad. At least I can help that much.
My sweet Capitano, if things were different...
Nothing more needs to be said, Savoia.
Are you ready for the gala?
Oh, wow. Savoia, you look gorgeous.
Oh! Um, you too, Capitano.
The Regia Marina know how to pick out a nice dress for you... and you sure know how to refuse them.
I told you I would look great in my regular uniform, didn't I?

Fields.MenuText: I mean, you really look nice.
Did you do something different with your hair?
That color always looks good on you.

Fields.DialogueText: Are you implying I don't usually look nice?
No, not really.
Wearing the Italian flag's colors always feels right, when I have the choice.
Well, care to take my arm, and I'll escort you in?
*ALARM*
Ah, I'm glad to see the gala is off to a great start...
@BATTLE
Good. I like it this way.
You always do. I like being able to finally tell you so.
Things seem to have calmed down again.
Wow, it seems like everyone is here. Is the whole Italian government on this ship?
Only the worthless ones. Everyone else is busy fighting.

Fields.MenuText: Careful no one overhears you say that, Savoia.
You really don't like parties, do you?
Do you really think that?

Fields.DialogueText: What are they going to do, put me in jail?
Not particularly, no.
I don't know. Maybe. It's hard to respect admirals and politicians when they're standing around hob-nobbing.
It is a lot of big people, though. Savoia, I just realized something.
I think I'm right there with you.
This isn't just a party...
... it's also a trap!
@BATTLE
That last battle... could've been easier.
It's not over yet, Capitano.
Savoia, I lost count of all the shells the Morganas are throwing at us right now, so in case we - and most of the Italian government - sink tonight, I should tell you...
No, Capitano... you shouldn't.
Maybe the "Capitano" isn't really necessary there?
We'll talk about this later.
@BATTLE
Whew! I think we did it.

Fields.MenuText: Was there ever really any doubt?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes. Quite a lot of it, actually.
Let's break out that special occasion wine. What do you say?
Good idea!

Fields.MenuText: Of course we did. When we team up, we never lose!
Everything in one piece?

Fields.DialogueText: You might just be right about that, Capitano.
I think so...
@BATTLE
We did it!
*APPLAUSE*
I'm pretty sure we just earned a bucket of medals.
We should do something special to celebrate.
What happened to chain of command?
I'm the ship. I'm not in the chain of command.

Fields.MenuText: Fair enough.
Now you decide that?
Does that mean I can't give you orders anymore?

Fields.DialogueText: Now, where we?
Did you have something special in mind?
Could you ever?
Capitano, if you have--
Now's not a good time, Lieutenant. Something just came up.
Of course, Capitano!
Another task force of Morganas, Savoia.
I don't remember inviting them to the after-party, Capitano. Battle stations!
Oh? Like a debriefing?
Savoia and I have some matters to sort out, so we'll need some privacy. You have the deck for now, Lieutenant.
Something like that, Lieutenant.
